metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1679 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ToV8Value function in content/child/v8_value_converter_impl.cc in the V8 bindings in Google Chrome before 51.0.2704.63 does not properly restrict use of getters and setters, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (use-after-free) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JavaScript code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1679` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1
chromium-browser-l10n - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1
chromium-chromedriver - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
